attributes.action: Anyone who claims benefits, let people know who reported them to DWP.
attributes.additional_details:
Not had a job for a good few years because of suffering depression. It's not fair when genuine depression sufferer's are targeted and you get people who pretend to have problems and they don't get done.

Anyway, anyone who claims benefits such as (ESA) I think DWP should let people know who reported the individuals to DWP, if DWP goes on what the certain people say, how do they know if they telling the truth? As it's hear say. Also they always have records on the system when people get a job
attributes.background: A family member was claiming Employment Support Allowance as  the money didn't go in, so called DWP to ask why they didn't get paid. So they told him they'd ring him back within half an hour which they did and gave my family member a number to call.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
